name: NETXP LINUX Suspicious network environment modification
description:
Rule monitors changes to network environment and configuration like:
Changes to Hostname:

Rule watches for changes to the hostname and domain name.
Key: network_modifications
Detect Remote Shell Use:

Monitors successful connections made by /bin/bash and /usr/bin/bash.
Key: remote_shell
Successful IPv4 Connections:

Monitors successful IPv4 connections.
Key: network_connect_4
Successful IPv6 Connections:

Monitors successful IPv6 connections.
Key: network_connect_6
Changes to Other Files:

Monitors write and attribute changes to various network-related files.
Files include /etc/hosts, /etc/sysconfig/network, /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts, /etc/network/, and /etc/NetworkManager/.
Key: network_modifications for most files, except /etc/NetworkManager/ which has a distinct key.
Changes to Issue Files:

Monitors write and attribute changes to /etc/issue and /etc/issue.net.
Keys: etcissue and etcissue.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
//any where auditd.log.key: "*network_modifications*" and
any where event.module: "auditd"
